result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Malik Leroy Little

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Malik Leroy Little in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Malik Leroy Little.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pretrial proceeded.  State's offer stated on the record.  Defense rejects State's offer.  Case remains in jury trial posture.  Case is adjourned to 11-14-22 at 8:30 am for Jury Trial.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Expires 11/28/2022.

Defendant Malik Leroy Little not in court, in custody.  Attorney Richard L. Voss Mr. in court for Malik Leroy Little.  Attorney Jessica Ann Behling in court for State of Wisconsin. Deputy Court Clerk: SD. 
Defense bail motion held.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court denies any bail modification.  Defense counsel enters SPEEDY trial demand on behalf defendant.  State moves for joinder with defendant's other case.  Defense counsel does not object.  Court grants joinder motion and will set this case for trial with defendant's pending case.  Case adjourned, Br. 10.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND. Court accepts the demand. Expiration date for Speedy Trial is November 15, 2022.

Defendant Malik Leroy Little in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Malik Leroy Little in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  Malik Leroy Little appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #22CF972. Sworn for the State: District Attorney Investigator G. Carrasco. State rests. Defense motions to dismiss due to defendant not being identified. State responds. Motion denied, Defense rests. Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Order Rescinding Defendant's Telephone, Visitation, and US Mail Custody Privilages, signed and filed.
Received, Filed, and Forwarded to the Judge for signature; Order Rescinding Privileges

Court orders $15,000.00 and TURN OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $20,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.

Defendant Malik Leroy Little in court with attorney Richard L. Voss.  Defendant Malik Leroy Little in custody.  Jessica Ann Behling appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
State's motion to rescind jail phone privileges.  Arguments heard.  For reasons stated on the record, Court will rescind all jail phone calls by the defendant.  State to supply court with a written order.

Case recalled at 2:05 pm.  Defendant in custody and present in court.  Court addressed bail.  For reasons stated on the record, Court orders $15,000.00 and TURN OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, bail to revert to $20,000.00.  If Alternative bail is paid, Defendant to be released and placed on Electronic Monitoring waiting list.  Court reminded defendant of previous no contact order.  Case remains calendared for Preliminary Hearing on 8/17/2022 at 8:30 am in Preliminary Hearing Court.
No contact order signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 4.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with KT.

Defendant Malik Leroy Little in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Malik Leroy Little in custody.  Anthony J Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Malik Leroy Little appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Defense to be heard as to bail regarding phone privileges.  Bail/bond hearing scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Malik Leroy Little
Current: 4690 N 71st Street, Milwaukee, WI 53208   (Effective: 08-07-2022)
Prior: 8885 South 68th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53132
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
